intro: Pogomesia undata, commonly known as the wavy pogostemon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its hairy, square stems and opposite, ovate leaves with wavy margins. Its small, tubular flowers are typically pink or purple and are arranged in whorls along the stem. Pogomesia undata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and modest floral display.
